</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	1993
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_NAME_AND_TITLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Nominating and Governance Committee (the &#147;Nominating Committee&#148;) evaluates the Board&#146;s
	membership from time to time in determining whether to recommend that incumbent directors be nominated for re-election. In this regard, the Nominating Committee considers whether the professional and educational background, business experience and
	expertise represented on the Board as a whole enables it to satisfy its oversight responsibilities in an effective manner.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The
	experience, qualifications, attributes and skills of each director of the Company, including his business experience during the past five years, are described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Thomas J. Carley
</B>
	has served as the Company&#146;s interim Principal Financial and Accounting Officer since March&nbsp;4, 2016. Mr.&nbsp;Carley was President and Chief Financial Officer of Jensen Securities,
	a securities and investment banking firm in Portland, Oregon, for eight years until February 1998, when the company was sold to D.A. Davidson&nbsp;&amp; Co. Thereafter, he was a research analyst at D.A. Davidson&nbsp;&amp; Co. covering technology
	companies and financial institutions, as well as the Company, until December 1999. Mr.&nbsp;Carley was a private investor until July 2006, when he co-founded Portal Capital, an investment management company. Since July 2006, Mr.&nbsp;Carley has
	acted as principal of Portal Capital with responsibility for all of Portal Capital&#146;s financial duties. Mr.&nbsp;Carley has an MBA from the University of Chicago Graduate School of Business, with an emphasis in Accounting and Finance, and an
	A.B. degree in Economics and Classics from Dartmouth College. He is also a director of Urth Organic Corporation, a distributor of organic agricultural products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Carley brings financial expertise to the Company and the Board through his prior experience in the areas of public accounting and financial analysis, including experience as an accountant with Price
	Waterhouse&nbsp;&amp; Co., now known as PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 60 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage62"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Carley served as Chair of the Board&#146;s Audit and Compliance Committee beginning in 2002 until March&nbsp;4, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Michael L. Elich
</B>
	joined the Company in October 2001 as Director of Business Development. He was appointed Vice President and Chief Operating
	Officer in May 2005. He was appointed interim President and Chief Executive Officer in January 2011 upon the death of William W. Sherertz. Effective February&nbsp;17, 2011, Mr.&nbsp;Elich was elected to the Board and his position as President and
	Chief Executive Officer was confirmed. From 1995 to 2001, Mr.&nbsp;Elich served as Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer of Skills Resource Training Center, a staffing services company with offices in Oregon, Washington and Idaho
	later acquired by the Company in 2004. Mr.&nbsp;Elich graduated from Montana State University with a B.S. degree in Economic Science. He is a member of Tournament Golf Foundation, a non-profit organization that has donated more than $14 million to
	children&#146;s charities since its inception in 1972.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Elich brings to the Board his deep knowledge of the Company&#146;s
	operations and industry and significant management experience.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	James B. Hicks
</B>
	is Research Professor of Cancer Genetics at Cold
	Spring Harbor Laboratory and a Research Professor at the University of Southern California. He also serves as Vice President for Science and director of GenDx, Inc., a cancer diagnostic company based in New York. He is a co-founder and director of
	Virogenomics, Inc., a biotechnology company located in the Portland, Oregon metropolitan area, for which he previously served as Chief Technology Officer. Dr.&nbsp;Hicks was a director of AVI BioPharma, Inc., from 1997 until October 2007 and a
	member of AVI BioPharma, Inc.&#146;s audit committee. Between 1990 and 2006, Dr.&nbsp;Hicks co-founded five biotech or internet companies. He completed a postdoctoral program at Cornell University, received a Ph.D. from the University of Oregon, and
	received a B.A. degree from Willamette University.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Through his experience with other public companies, Dr.&nbsp;Hicks provides valuable
	business and financial insight to the Board. He is chair of the Board&#146;s Compensation Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Roger L. Johnson
</B>
	has been
	the Managing Partner of Summa Global Advisors, LLC, since October 2008. He was a Principal of Coldstream Capital Management, Inc., a wealth management firm headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, from 2005 until 2008. Mr.&nbsp;Johnson was President
	and CEO of Western Pacific Investment Advisers, Inc., for 15&nbsp;years until its acquisition by Coldstream in 2005. Mr.&nbsp;Johnson is an ROTC Distinguished Military Graduate of Gonzaga University, with a B.A. degree in Psychology and minors in
	business administration and philosophy. After college, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson was an Infantry Captain in the U.S. Army in Vietnam, where his assignments included serving as a platoon leader in the 101st Airborne Division, an infantry advisor, and a
	company commander. Mr.&nbsp;Johnson has 42&nbsp;years of experience in the financial services industry, including extensive experience in asset allocation and portfolio management. Mr.&nbsp;Johnson serves as director, secretary, and treasurer of
	Waverly Historic Foundation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As a result of his involvement in the financial services industry, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson contributes his
	business, leadership and management perspectives as a director of the Company and chair of the Board&#146;s Investment Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 61 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage63"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Jon L. Justesen
</B>
	is co-owner and Chief Executive Officer of Justesen Ranches, which operates in
	four counties in two states. He is also owner and President of Buckhollow Ranch, Inc., and has 35 years of experience creating wealth as a private investor. During Mr.&nbsp;Justesen&#146;s 40 plus years of successfully growing and managing
	agribusinesses in eastern Oregon, he has overseen operations involving timber, wheat and cattle production, property management and development, and resource-based recreational activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Justesen brings to the Board leadership and business management skills developed during his lifelong career managing substantial ranching
	operations. He also provides the Company with connections to potential customers through his personal network of business contacts developed in several geographic markets in which the Company operates. Mr.&nbsp;Justesen is chair of the Board&#146;s
	Nominating Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Johnson and Mr.&nbsp;Justesen are first cousins.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Anthony Meeker
</B>
	serves as Chairman of the Board. He retired in 2003 as a Managing Director of Victory Capital Management, Inc. (formerly
	known as Key Asset Management, Inc.), where he was employed for 10 years. Mr.&nbsp;Meeker was previously a director of First Federal Savings and Loan Association of McMinnville, Oregon and Oregon Mutual Insurance. He also serves on the board of two
	charitable organizations, MV Advancements, which provides employment, residential, and community services to clients with disabilities, and Oregon State Capitol Foundation. From 1987 to 1993, Mr.&nbsp;Meeker was Treasurer of the State of Oregon. His
	duties as state treasurer included investing the assets of the state, including the then $26 billion state pension fund, managing the state debt, and supervising all cash management programs. Mr.&nbsp;Meeker also managed the workers compensation
	insurance reserve fund of the State Accident Insurance Fund, providing oversight to ensure adequate actuarial reserves. He received a B.A. degree from Willamette University.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Mr.&nbsp;Meeker&#146;s experience in the insurance industry assists the Company in managing risk with respect to workers&#146; compensation and overseeing its captive insurance subsidiaries. Mr.&nbsp;Meeker also
	brings leadership skills and a unique insight as a result of his public service as state treasurer and service on other corporate boards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Background
	and Experience of Executive Officers
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In addition to Messrs. Carley and Elich, whose background information is presented above under
	&#147;Background and Qualifications of Directors,&#148; Gregory R. Vaughn and Gerald R. Blotz currently serve as executive officers of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Gregory R. Vaughn, age 60, has served as an officer of the Company since 1998. He joined the Company in July 1997 as Operations Manager. Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn was appointed Vice President in January 1998 and Chief
	Administrative Officer in February 2012. He was promoted to Chief Operating Officer-Corporate Operations in May 2014. Prior to joining BBSI, Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn was Chief Executive Officer of Insource America, Inc., a privately-held human resource
	management company headquartered in Portland, Oregon, for approximately one year. Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn has also held senior management positions with Sundial Time Systems, Inc., and Continental Information Systems, Inc. Previously, Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn was
	employed as a technology consultant by Price Waterhouse&nbsp;&amp; Co.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 62 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage64"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Gerald R. Blotz, age 46, joined the Company in May 2002 as Area Manager of the San Jose branch office.
	Mr.&nbsp;Blotz was promoted to Vice President, Chief Operating Officer-Field Operations in May 2014. Prior to joining BBSI, Gerald was President and Chief Operating Officer of ProTrades Connection, where he was instrumental in building ProTrades to
	44 offices in four states.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Section&nbsp;16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Section&nbsp;16 of the Exchange Act (&#147;Section&nbsp;16&#148;) requires that reports of beneficial ownership of Common Stock and changes in such
	ownership be filed with the SEC by Section&nbsp;16 &#147;reporting persons,&#148; including directors, executive officers, and certain holders of more than 10% of the outstanding Common Stock. To the Company&#146;s knowledge, based solely on a
	review of the copies of Forms 3, 4 and 5 (and amendments thereto) filed with the SEC and written representations by the Company&#146;s directors and executive officers, all Section&nbsp;16 reporting persons complied with all applicable
	Section&nbsp;16(a) filing requirements during 2015 on a timely basis other than one late report filed by Jon Justesen, a director of the Company, reporting an open market purchase and another late report filed by James Hicks, also a director of the
	Company, reporting 15 purchases of shares with reinvested dividends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Code of Ethics
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company has adopted a Code of Ethics for Senior Financial Officers (&#147;Code of Ethics&#148;), which is applicable to the Company&#146;s
	principal executive officer, principal financial officer and principal accounting officer. The Code of Ethics focuses on honest and ethical conduct, the adequacy of disclosure in financial reports of the Company, and compliance with applicable laws
	and regulations. The Code of Ethics is included as part of the Company&#146;s Code of Business Conduct, which is generally applicable to all of the Company&#146;s directors, officers, and employees. The Code of Business Conduct is available on the
	Company&#146;s website at www.barrettbusiness.com in the &#147;Investor Relations&#148; section.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Changes to Board Nomination Procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	There have been no material changes to the procedures by which security holders may recommend nominees to our Board of Directors
	from those described in the Company&#146;s definitive Proxy Statement for its 2015 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Audit Committee
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company has a separately-designated standing audit committee established in accordance with Section&nbsp;3(a)(58)(A) of the Exchange Act known
	as the Audit and Compliance Committee (the &#147;Audit Committee&#148;). The current members of the Audit Committee are Anthony Meeker, Chair, James B. Hicks, Ph.D., and Roger L. Johnson, each of whom is independent as that term is used in NASDAQ
	listing standards applicable to the Company. As a result of the resignation of Thomas J. Carley from the Audit Committee in March 2016, the Company&#146;s Board of Directors has determined that no member of the Audit Committee currently qualifies as
	an &#147;audit committee financial expert&#148; as defined by Item&nbsp;407(d)(5) of Regulation S-K under the Exchange Act. The Board is in the process of recruiting an additional independent director who would meet this definition and also serve as
	Chair of the Audit Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 63 -
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Directors (other than directors who are full-time employees of the Company, who do not receive directors&#146; fees) are entitled to receive an annual retainer payable monthly in
	cash. The annual retainer is $50,000 for each independent director other than the Chairman of the Board, whose annual retainer is $90,000, while committee chairs and committee members receive annual retainers as follows: Audit Committee, $15,000 and
	$7,500; Compensation Committee, $10,000 and $5,000; Nominating and Governance Committee, $7,500 and $3,750; and Investment Committee, $7,500, and $3,750.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Reflects the grant date fair value of 1,285 restricted stock units (&#147;RSUs&#148;) granted to each director using the closing share price on the grant date, July&nbsp;1, 2015,
	of $38.90 per share. Each RSU represents a contingent right to receive one share of the Company&#146;s Common Stock. The RSUs vest in four equal annual installments beginning on July&nbsp;1, 2016, and will be settled by delivery of unrestricted
	shares of Common Stock on the vesting date.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, each of the Company&#146;s outside directors held a total of 3,172 RSUs. Also as of that date, the Company&#146;s outside directors held stock options
	as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Carley, 5,875 shares; Dr.&nbsp;Hicks, 13,875&nbsp;shares; Mr.&nbsp;Johnson, 9,000&nbsp;shares; Mr.&nbsp;Justesen, 9,000&nbsp;shares; and Mr.&nbsp;Meeker, 9,000&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(4)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Effective March&nbsp;4, 2016, Mr.&nbsp;Carley was appointed interim Chief Financial Officer of the Company with a base salary of $25,000 per month.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Compensation Discussion and
	Analysis
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	Compensation Philosophy and Objectives.
</U>
</B>
	The Compensation Committee (for purposes of this section, the
	&#147;Committee&#148;) has responsibility for establishing, implementing, and continually monitoring adherence with the Company&#146;s compensation philosophy. The goal of the Committee is to ensure that the total compensation paid to the
	Company&#146;s executive officers is fair, reasonable, and competitive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 64 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Committee believes that the most effective executive compensation program is one that is designed
	to reward the achievement of specific annual or long-term strategic goals by the Company. The principles underlying our compensation policies are:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	To attract and retain qualified people;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	To provide competitive compensation relative to compensation paid to similarly situated executives; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	To align the interests of executives to build long-term stockholder value.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Committee has taken steps over the past several years to cause the Company&#146;s incentive compensation program to qualify, at least in
	substantial part, as performance-based compensation under Internal Revenue Code Section&nbsp;162(m). See &#147;Deductibility of Executive Compensation&#148; below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	At the 2015 annual meeting of stockholders, more than 97% of the votes cast with respect to the advisory vote on executive compensation approved the compensation of the Company&#146;s named executive officers. The
	Committee took this indication of support into consideration in reviewing the Company&#146;s executive compensation program.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	2015
	Executive Compensation Components
</U>
	.
</B>
	For the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the principal components of compensation for executive officers were:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Base salary;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Target annual cash incentive compensation
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Grants of incentive stock options; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Grants of restricted stock units.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Base
	Salary
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Salary levels of executive officers are reviewed periodically by the Committee and the CEO as part of the performance review
	process, as well as upon a promotion or other change in job responsibility. In determining base salaries for executives in 2015, the Committee primarily considered:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Available market data;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</FONT>
</TD>

	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Scope of responsibilities; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Individual performance of the executive.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In light of the significant increases in executive officer base salaries, ranging from 22% to 30%, approved in 2014, the Committee determined not to adjust salary levels for 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 65 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Annual Cash Incentive Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s executive officers were eligible to receive cash incentive bonuses following year end for services during 2015. The target bonus amounts were set by the Committee in March 2015 as follows:
	Mr.&nbsp;Elich, $560,000; Mr.&nbsp;Miller, $280,000; Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn, $280,000; and Mr.&nbsp;Blotz, $280,000. Of the total bonus opportunity, 75% was awarded under the Company&#146;s Annual Cash Incentive Award Plan based on achievement of objective
	corporate performance goals selected by the Committee from among the goals approved by the Company&#146;s stockholders in 2014. The other 25% of the total bonus opportunity was reserved for award in the Committee&#146;s discretion based on its
	subjective assessment of each officer&#146;s performance during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Achievement above or below established target levels for the
	corporate financial metrics results in an upward or downward adjustment in the bonus amount payable for corporate level goals. The adjustment is calculated based on a defined factor (2.5% for 2015) multiplied by the percentage by which the actual
	achievement of a given metric is above or below the target level. If the Company fails to achieve a specified financial target at the 80% level or above, no part of the bonus associated with that metric is earned. The maximum bonus payable is 200%
	of the target bonus amount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In late March&nbsp;2016, the Committee performed a subjective evaluation of the performances of
	Messrs.&nbsp;Elich, Vaughn, and Blotz during 2015. On May&nbsp;13, 2016, the Committee finalized its determination of the extent to which the corporate level goals for 2015 had been satisfied. An executive must remain employed by the Company through
	the date of the Committee&#146;s determination to be eligible to receive a bonus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	For 2015, the corporate portion of the bonus was
	based 50% on achievement of earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortization (&#147;EBITDA&#148;), at a target level of $37,878,000, and 50% on achievement of gross non-GAAP revenues at a target level of $3,961,260,000. The Company
	achieved EBITDA of $39,962,000, 6% above the target amount, and gross non-GAAP revenues of $4,016,150,000, 1% above the target amount, for 2015, resulting in non-discretionary cash incentive bonuses for Messrs.&nbsp;Vaughn and Blotz as shown in the
	Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation column in the Summary Compensation Table below. The Committee also approved discretionary cash bonuses in the amount of $70,000 for each of Messrs.&nbsp;Vaughn and Blotz. The Committee determined that, in light
	of recent developments at the Company, payment of a cash incentive bonus to Mr.&nbsp;Elich for 2015 was inappropriate. Mr.&nbsp;Miller was not eligible for a bonus as his employment with the Company was terminated in March&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Long-Term Equity Incentive Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In
	February&nbsp;2015, the Committee determined that no cash bonuses would be paid to the Company&#146;s executive officers for services in 2014. However, the Committee believed that the executive officers should receive equity incentive compensation
	in light of their significant efforts on behalf of the Company as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s achievement of record gross revenues in 2014;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Successful implementation of a fronted workers&#146; compensation insurance program with the ACE Group with respect to the Company&#146;s customers in California
	during 2014;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Successful negotiation of an expanded credit facility with the Company&#146;s principal lender in December 2014; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Full compliance with applicable state workers&#146; compensation reserve requirements as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Accordingly, the Committee granted incentive stock options to each executive officer under the 2009 Stock Incentive Plan as shown in the Grants of
	Plan-Based Awards table below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Committee began awarding restricted stock units (&#147;RSUs&#148;) to the Company&#146;s executive
	officers, as well as outside directors, beginning in 2012. The change was made to provide a more immediate opportunity to receive an ownership stake in the Company than is afforded by employee stock options, and also because the Committee believes
	the accounting treatment of RSUs more fully reflects the cost to the Company and stockholders of equity compensation than stock options. The RSU grants are intended to serve as a significant incentive aligning the long-term interests of the
	executive team with the interests of the Company&#146;s stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In July 2015, the Committee approved additional grants of RSUs to
	the Company&#146;s executive officers under the Company&#146;s 2015 Stock Incentive Plan approved by the stockholders in May 2015. Mr.&nbsp;Elich was granted 20,000 RSUs and Messrs.&nbsp;Blotz, Miller, and Vaughn were each granted 10,000 RSUs. Each
	RSU represents a contingent right to receive one share of Common Stock. The RSUs will vest in four equal annual installments beginning in July 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In late March&nbsp;2016, the Committee granted additional equity awards to Messrs.&nbsp;Elich, Vaughn, and Blotz under the 2015 Stock Incentive Plan. The awards were in the form of performance shares, the vesting
	of which is conditioned on attaining specified target amounts of gross revenues, EBITDA, and net income for the year ending December&nbsp;31, 2018, with issuance of shares of Common Stock in settlement of the awards, based on the market price of the
	shares on the settlement date, to occur no later than June&nbsp;30, 2019. The dollar value of shares to be issued in settlement of the performance share awards if the target levels are achieved is as follows: Mr.&nbsp;Elich, $292,500;
	Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn, $120,000; and Mr.&nbsp;Blotz, $120,000, with one-third of the performance shares tied to achievement of each of the three financial metrics. Target award amounts are subject to upward or downward adjustment by 2.5% for each one
	percent by which the actual achievement of a given financial metric is above or below the target level, but not less than 80% of the target level or more than 140% of the target level. If achievement is below the 80% level, no part of the target
	award tied to that financial metric would be paid. At the 80% level, 50% of the target award for the related financial metric would be paid. The maximum payout is 200% of a target award. The performance share awards are not intended to replace the
	annual grants of RSUs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 67 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Retirement Benefits
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Employees, including executive officers, may participate in the Company&#146;s 401(k) defined contribution plan. The Company matches each employee&#146;s contributions at a rate of 100% on the first 3% of salary
	deferrals and 50% on the next 2% of salary deferrals, with a maximum Company-paid match of $10,600. All executive officers participated and had contributions to the 401(k) plan matched at the maximum amount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Change in Control Employment Agreements
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The
	Company entered into agreements with Messrs. Elich and Vaughn in April 2011 and with Mr.&nbsp;Blotz in June 2015 that provide for severance benefits in the event that the officer&#146;s employment is terminated by the Company without cause (as
	defined) or by the officer for good reason (as defined) following a change in control of the Company, as described in greater detail under &#147;Potential Payments upon Certain Terminations Following a Change in Control&#148; below. The Committee
	approved the agreements with the goal of providing the Company&#146;s stockholders with greater assurance of stability within senior management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Death Benefit Agreements
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company
	entered into agreements with Messrs. Elich and Vaughn in January 2014 and with Mr.&nbsp;Blotz in July 2015 that provide, in the event of the executive officer&#146;s death, for the Company to make a lump sum payment to the executive officer&#146;s
	designated beneficiary. These agreements are discussed in more detail under &#147;Potential Payments upon Death or Termination for Disability&#148; below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
<U>
	Deductibility of Executive Compensation
</U>
	.
</B>
	The Committee reviews and considers the deductibility of executive compensation under Code Section&nbsp;162(m), which limits the deductibility for federal
	income tax purposes of annual compensation totaling more than $1,000,000 paid to certain executive officers, with exceptions for qualifying performance-based compensation. Stock options granted under a stockholder-approved plan with an exercise
	price equal to fair market value on the date of grant qualify as performance-based. Until 2015, all other elements of our executive compensation program have not so qualified.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In 2014, the Compensation Committee recognized that the ongoing need to increase compensation levels to provide competitive pay to its executive officers could cause at least the CEO&#146;s compensation to exceed
	the Section&nbsp;162(m) $1,000,000 cap in the near future. As a result, the Committee recommended and the Board approved the submission of the Annual Cash Incentive Award Plan for approval by the stockholders at the 2014 annual meeting. Approval of
	the plan resulted in the approval of performance goals for purposes of Section&nbsp;162(m). As a result, starting in 2015, target annual cash incentive bonuses awarded under the Annual Cash Incentive Award Plan subject to the achievement of
	objective performance goals are expected to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section&nbsp;162(m).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Similarly, in early
	April 2015 the Committee recommended and the Board approved the submission of the 2015 Stock Incentive Plan for approval by the stockholders at the 2015 annual meeting. This plan permits the grant of various types of equity awards, some of which are
	designed to qualify as performance based under Section&nbsp;162(m). As discussed above,
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 68 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage70"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	the Committee granted equity based awards to the Company&#146;s executive officers in March 2016 that are intended to qualify in part as performance-based compensation under Section&nbsp;162(m).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Committee has determined to continue awarding some executive compensation, in addition to salaries and benefits, that does not be
	meet the Section&nbsp;162(m) requirements in an effort to assure that our compensation program is competitive with our peers and allows us to continue to attract and retain highly-qualified individuals with the skills and enthusiasm to generate
	significant value for our stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<U>
<B>
	Peer Group and Survey Data for Comparison Purposes
</B>
	.
</U>
	During 2013 the Committee
	engaged Mercer, a nationally-recognized compensation consultant, to provide advice to the Committee regarding the structure and implementation of the Company&#146;s executive compensation program. Among other things, the Committee asked Mercer to
	analyze whether our compensation programs are reasonable and competitive in the marketplace. In July 2013, following discussions with the Committee, Mercer recommended and the Committee approved a peer group of 15 companies in the human resource and
	employment services industry and similar companies with a market capitalization ranging from a low of approximately $125,000,000 to a high of approximately $1,100,000,000. Members of the peer group include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The peer group was developed in consultation with Mercer without consideration of individual company compensation
	practices, and no company was included or excluded from the peer group due to paying above-average or below-average compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Mercer also provided the Committee with an analysis of compensation paid to the Company&#146;s executive officers compared to survey data for
	similarly sized companies in a 2012 report prepared by Mercer and a 2012/2013 survey conducted by another nationally-recognized compensation consulting firm. The survey data presented compensation amounts based on information from a large number of
	companies across a broad range of industries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Based on its analysis of the peer group and survey data, Mercer
	advised, among other things, that the levels of actual and target total direct compensation for the Company&#146;s executive officers for 2012 placed Mr.&nbsp;Elich at well below the 25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	th
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	percentile compared to market, between the 25
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	th
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	and
	50
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	th
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	percentiles for Mr.&nbsp;Miller, and at or above the 75
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
	th
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	percentile for Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn. The Committee believes that Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn&#146;s scope
	of duties and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 69 -
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage71"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	responsibilities is greater than for many of the companies included in the peer group and survey data with respect to the position of chief administrative officer, the comparison position used by
	Mercer for Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn. The Committee took the Mercer data into consideration in making decisions regarding salaries, target annual cash incentive bonuses and RSU awards for 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In March&nbsp;2016, the Committee authorized the Committee Chair to contact Mercer to obtain peer compensation data for the Chief Financial Officer
	position in light of the executive search to recruit a permanent CFO. The Committee also intends to engage an independent compensation consultant during 2016 to obtain an updated analysis of executive compensation data for all executive officer
	positions.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

</EFX_COMPENSATION_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The amounts shown represent discretionary cash bonuses awarded by the Compensation Committee based on its evaluation of each officer&#146;s individual performance. Additional
	information regarding the Company&#146;s annual cash incentive bonus program appears under the subheading &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#148; above.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Reflects the grant date fair value of &#147;RSUs&#148; granted to executive officers using the closing price of the Common Stock on the grant date. Each RSU represents a
	contingent right to receive one share of Common Stock. The RSUs vest in four equal annual installments beginning one year after the grant date and will be settled by delivery of unrestricted shares of Common Stock on the vesting date. Vesting of the
	RSUs would accelerate upon a change in control or a participant&#146;s death or termination of employment by reason of disability.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	The amounts shown represent the grant date fair value of employee stock options under the Company&#146;s 2009 Stock Incentive Plan. The actual value to be received pursuant to
	the option awards is dependent on the appreciation in our stock price prior to the exercise or expiration of the options. Additional details regarding the terms of outstanding stock options held by the named executive officers are described below
	under &#147;Incentive Compensation.&#148; Assumptions used in calculating grant date fair value are described in Note&nbsp;11 to the consolidated financial statements incorporated into Item&nbsp;8 of Part&nbsp;II of this report.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	(4)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Amounts shown represent performance-based cash bonuses paid pursuant to the Company&#146;s annual cash incentive bonus program in effect during the years shown. Additional
	information regarding the bonus program appears under the subheading &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#148; above. As a result of the termination of Mr.&nbsp;Miller&#146;s employment in March 2016, his award under the Annual Cash Incentive
	Award Plan for 2015 was forfeited.
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Represents the potential annual non-discretionary cash incentive bonus amounts under the Company&#146;s Annual Cash Incentive Award Plan based on the level of achievement of
	corporate performance goals as described under &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#148; above. The target amounts were payable if the overall achievement level was 100%. For each percentage point that achievement of the goal falls above or
	below the target level in a particular year, the bonus amount attributable to that goal is increased or reduced by 2.5%; provided the maximum bonus is 200% of target and no amounts are payable for achievement at 80% of the target levels or below.
	Actual bonuses paid are shown in the Summary Compensation Table above.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Reflects the grant of &#147;RSUs&#148; under the 2015 Stock Incentive Plan. Each RSU represents a contingent right to receive one share of Common Stock. The RSUs vest in four
	equal annual installments beginning on the one-year anniversary of the grant date, and will be settled by delivery of unrestricted shares of Common Stock on the vesting date. Vesting of the RSUs would accelerate upon a change in control or a
	participant&#146;s death or termination of employment by reason of disability.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="1">
	Reflects stock options granted under the 2009 Stock Incentive Plan that vest in four equal annual installments beginning one year after the date of grant and expire 10&nbsp;years
	after the date of grant.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(4)

	The exercise price is equal to the closing sale price of our Common Stock on the date of grant.
</FONT>
</TD>

</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Potential Payments Upon Certain Terminations Following a Change in Control
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In April 2011, the Compensation Committee approved Change in Control Employment Agreements (the &#147;CIC Agreements&#148;) with Messrs. Elich and Vaughn. In June 2015, at the direction of the Compensation
	Committee, the Company entered into a similar CIC Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Blotz. A similar agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Miller terminated upon the termination of his employment in March 2016. The CIC Agreements provide for compensation in the form of a
	severance payment in the event that the executive officer&#146;s employment is terminated following a change in control of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Under the CIC Agreements, if employment is terminated by the Company (other than for cause, death or disability), or by the executive for good
	reason, within 12 months following a change in control, the executive will be entitled to receive an amount equal to three times the sum of (x)&nbsp;his annual base salary plus (y)&nbsp;his target annual cash bonus, in a lump sum within 30 days
	after his termination. If payment of these benefits would result in an &#147;excess parachute payment&#148; as defined in Code Section&nbsp;280G, such payments shall be reduced to the largest amount that will result in no portion of the payments
	being subject to the excise tax imposed by Code Section&nbsp;4999.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Brief summaries of the definitions of certain terms used in the CIC
	Agreements are set forth below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#147;Change in control&#148; means:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The acquisition by a person or group of beneficial ownership of 30% or more of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s outstanding voting securities;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A change in the composition of the Board during any 12-month period such that the incumbent directors cease to constitute at least a majority of the Board, with
	certain exceptions;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Completion of a consolidation, merger, or sale, lease, exchange, or other transfer of substantially all the assets of the Company, with certain exceptions; or
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Approval by the Company&#146;s stockholders of a liquidation or dissolution of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_14"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#147;Cause&#148; means:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>

<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The willful failure to comply with any of the Company&#146;s material and lawful policies or standards, subject to certain notice requirements;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Embezzlement, theft, larceny, fraud, or other material acts of dishonesty; or
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Conviction of or entry of a plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a felony.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#147;Good reason,&#148; for purposes of an executive&#146;s termination of his employment with the Company following a change in control, means:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The executive experiences a material adverse change in his authority, duties, or responsibilities;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A material change in the executive&#146;s supervisor, including reporting to a successor board of directors of which fewer than half of the members were
	directors of the Company immediately prior to the change in control or, for Messrs. Blotz and Vaughn, if Mr.&nbsp;Elich ceases to be Chief Executive Officer for reasons other than cause, death or disability;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The executive&#146;s base compensation (salary or target annual cash bonus) is reduced;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The executive is transferred to a location more than 50&nbsp;miles from the present location;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The successor company does not agree to perform under the agreement; or
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company does not comply with the material terms of the agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	All outstanding stock options and RSUs held by the executives will also become exercisable in full following a change in control of the Company, whether or not the executive&#146;s employment is terminated.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Each of our executives has entered into a separate non-competition agreement under which he has agreed not to become an owner,
	stockholder, partner, officer, or employee of a business that is engaged in or competes with the Company in any geographic area in which the Company has done business during the three months preceding termination of his employment, and not to
	solicit the Company&#146;s customers or employees, for a period of 18 months after he is no longer employed by the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 74 -
</FONT>
</P>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The following table shows potential pay-outs under the CIC Agreements as of December&nbsp;31, 2015,
	assuming that employment was terminated following a change in control of the Company, either by the Company for reasons other than cause, death or disability, or by the executive for good reason, and that termination occurred on that date. The table
	also shows the value of outstanding employee stock options and RSUs that were not vested on December&nbsp;31, 2015, but would become exercisable in full upon a change in control of the Company, whether or not the executive&#146;s employment is
	terminated.
</FONT>
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Equal to three times the sum of the executive&#146;s annual base salary level at December&nbsp;31, 2015, and the target cash incentive bonus for 2015, reduced to the extent
	necessary to avoid imposition of the excise tax imposed under Code Section&nbsp;4999 on excess parachute payments as defined in Code Section&nbsp;280G. The amounts shown reflect elimination of the cash severance due to these reductions as follows:
	Mr.&nbsp;Elich $2,115,707; Mr.&nbsp;Miller, $0; Mr.&nbsp;Vaughn, $1,129,807; and Mr.&nbsp;Blotz, $695,341.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Reflects the market value of unvested RSUs plus the difference (the &#147;spread&#148;) between the closing sale price of the Common Stock on The Nasdaq Stock Market on
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, $43.54 per share, and the per share exercise price for unvested options. See &#147;Outstanding Equity Awards at December&nbsp;31, 2015&#148; above for additional information.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	(3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Compensation Committee determined that the termination of Mr.&nbsp;Miller&#146;s employment on March&nbsp;3, 2016, was for cause. Consequently, the stock options and RSUs
	held by Mr.&nbsp;Miller on the date of his termination were cancelled, whether vested or unvested, and he was not paid any severance.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Potential Payments Upon Death or Termination for Disability
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In late 2013, the Compensation Committee approved Death Benefit Agreements with Messrs. Elich, and Vaughn, which agreements became effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2014. A Death Benefit Agreement entered into with
	Mr.&nbsp;Blotz became effective as of July&nbsp;17, 2015. Under each agreement, the Company will make a lump sum payment to the executive officer&#146;s designated beneficiary within 60 days after the date of death. Benefit payments for Messrs.
	Elich, Vaughn, and Blotz would be $1,300,000, $800,000, and $800,000, respectively. The benefit would be forfeited upon an executive officer&#146;s termination of employment with the Company for any reason other than death. A similar agreement with
	Mr.&nbsp;Miller that would have provided a death benefit of $800,000 was terminated upon termination of his employment in March&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A death benefit will be payable solely out of the general assets of the Company, which may include funds received from life insurance policies on the executive officers put in place by the Company. No death benefit
	will be payable under an agreement if the executive officer&#146;s death occurs under circumstances causing the policy amount not to be paid in full.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In addition to the Death Benefit Agreements, all RSUs and stock options that are unvested at an executive officers&#146; death or termination of employment by reason of disability
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	- 75 -
</FONT>
</P>

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	will immediately vest in full. The value of unvested RSUs and stock options held by the named executive officers at December&nbsp;31, 2015, is shown above under the subheading &#147;Potential
	Payments Upon Certain Terminations Following a Change in Control.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Messrs. Carley, Hicks, and Justesen served on the Compensation Committee during 2015. During 2015, none of the Company&#146;s executive officers
	served on the board of directors of any entity whose directors or officers serve on our Compensation Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Compensation Committee Report
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Compensation Committee is charged with carrying out the Board&#146;s overall responsibilities relating to compensation of the
	Company&#146;s executive officers. The Compensation Committee has reviewed the section headed &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#148; and has discussed its contents with members of the Company&#146;s management. Based on its review and
	discussions, the Compensation Committee has recommended to the Board of Directors that the section headed &#147;Compensation Discussion and Analysis&#148; be included in the Company&#146;s Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, and the Company&#146;s proxy statement on Schedule 14A.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Submitted by the Compensation Committee of the Board of
	Directors:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:65%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	James B. Hicks, Ph.D., Chair
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:65%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Roger L. Johnson
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:65%; TEXT-INDENT:-2%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Jon L. Justesen
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="11%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Item&nbsp;12.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
<U>
	SECURITY O
<A NAME="D62398D10K_HTM_TX62398_20">
</A>
	WNERSHIP OF CERTAIN BENEFICIAL OWNERS AND MANAGEMENT AND RELATED STOCKHOLDER MATTERS
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Beneficial Ownership Table
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The following
	table sets forth information regarding the beneficial ownership of Common Stock as of April&nbsp;30, 2016, by each director, by each executive officer and by all directors and executive officers of the Company as a group. In addition, it provides
	information about each other person or group known to the Company to own beneficially more than 5 percent of the outstanding shares of Common Stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:9%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Unless otherwise indicated, all shares listed as beneficially owned are held with sole voting and dispositive power.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The following table summarizes information regarding shares of Common Stock that may be issued upon exercise of options, warrants, and rights under the Company&#146;s existing equity compensation plans and
	arrangements as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. The only plan under which equity compensation could be awarded at December&nbsp;31, 2015, was the Company&#146;s 2015 Stock Incentive Plan, which was approved by stockholders in May 2015. Prior to 2015,
</FONT>
