<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Fair Value Measurement
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Fair value is the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction
	between market participants at the measurement date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In determining the fair value of our financial assets, the Company predominately
	uses the market approach. In determining the fair value of all its money market funds, certificates of deposit, municipal bonds, corporate bonds, and U.S. treasury bills, the Company
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-26
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage109"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
<B>
	Barrett Business Services, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
</B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	4.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Fair Value Measurement&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	utilizes non-binding quotes provided by our five investment brokers. We received one non-binding broker quote for each financial asset as of the balance sheet date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Factors used in determining the fair value of our financial assets and liabilities are summarized into three levels as established in the fair
	value hierarchy framework. The three levels of the fair value hierarchy are described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Level 1&#151;Inputs to the valuation
	methodology are unadjusted quoted prices for identical assets or liabilities in active markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Level 2&#151;Inputs to the valuation
	methodology include:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Quoted prices for similar assets or liabilities in active markets;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in inactive markets;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data by correlation or other means.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Level 3&#151;Inputs to the valuation methodology are unobservable and significant to the fair value measurement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In determining the fair value measurement of our financial assets, the fair value measurement level within the hierarchy is based on the lowest
	level input and is applied to each financial asset. Valuation techniques are used to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-27
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-29
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
<B>
	Barrett Business Services, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
</B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Workers&#146; Compensation Claims
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company is a self-insured employer with respect to workers&#146; compensation coverage for all of its employees (including
	employees co-employed through our client service agreements) working in Colorado, Delaware, Maryland and Oregon, except as described below. In the state of Washington, state law allows only the Company&#146;s staffing services and internal
	management employees to be covered under the Company&#146;s self-insured workers&#146; compensation program. The Company&#146;s wholly owned, fully licensed insurance company, Ecole, provides workers&#146; compensation coverage to our employees in
	Arizona, Nevada and Utah.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Effective January&nbsp;1, 2015, the Company stopped maintaining a certificate to self-insure in the state of
	California, and it now obtains individual policies from ACE Group (&#147;ACE&#148;) for all California-based clients along with clients in Delaware, Virginia, Pennsylvania and the District of Columbia. The arrangement with ACE, typically known as a
	fronted program, provides BBSI a licensed, admitted insurance carrier to issue policies on behalf of BBSI without the intention of transferring any of the workers&#146; compensation risk for the first $5.0 million per claim. The risk of loss up to
	the first $5.0 million per claim is retained by BBSI through an indemnity agreement. While this portion of the risk of loss remains with BBSI, ACE assumes credit risk should BBSI be unable to satisfy its indemnification obligations to ACE. The
	arrangement is effective through February 2017 with the potential for continued annual renewals thereafter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As part of the ACE fronted
	program, the Company makes monthly payments into a trust account (&#147;the ACE trust account&#148;) to be used for the payment of future claims. The balance in the ACE trust account was $166.6 million and $50.1 million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, respectively. The ACE trust account balance is included as a component of the current and long-term restricted marketable securities and workers&#146; compensation deposits in the Company&#146;s consolidated balance sheets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In the event of catastrophic injuries or fatalities, the Company maintains excess workers&#146; compensation insurance through its
	wholly owned captive insurance company, AICE, with a per occurrence retention of $5.0 million, except in Maryland and Colorado, where our per occurrence retention is $1.0 million and $2.0 million, respectively. AICE maintains excess workers&#146;
	compensation insurance coverage with ACE, between $5.0 million and $15.0 million per occurrence, except in Maryland, where coverage with ACE is between $1.0 million and $25.0 million per occurrence, and in Colorado, where the coverage with ACE is
	between $2.0 million and applicable statutory limits per occurrence.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company provided a total of $255.7 million and $225.3 million
	at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, as an estimated future liability for unsettled workers&#146; compensation claims liabilities. The estimated liability for unsettled workers&#146; compensation claims represents management&#146;s best
	estimate based upon an actuarial valuation provided by a third party actuary at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014. Included in the claims liabilities are case reserve estimates for reported losses, plus additional
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-30
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage113"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
<B>
	Barrett Business Services, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
</B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Workers&#146; Compensation Claims&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	amounts for estimated future adverse cost development of reported claims, incurred but not reported claims, legal expenses, MCC expenses, as well as estimates for unallocated loss adjustment
	expenses which include future administrative fees paid to third party service providers. These estimates are reviewed frequently and adjustments to liabilities are reflected in current operating results as they become known.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Our workers&#146; compensation claims liabilities do not represent an exact calculation of liability but rather management&#146;s best estimate,
	utilizing actuarial expertise and projection techniques, at a given accounting date. The process of arriving at an estimate of unpaid claims and claims adjustment expense involves a high degree of judgment and is affected by both internal and
	external events, including changes in claims handling practices, modifications in reserve estimation procedures, changes in individuals involved in the reserve estimation process, inflation, trends in the litigation and settlement of pending claims
	and legislative changes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Beginning in late 2013 and continuing into the second half of 2014, the Company took the following actions to
	improve its claims handling practices:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Hired additional claims administrators.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Completed a specific case reserve study for all claims with injury dates 2012 and earlier (resulting in moving dollars from the general reserve of incurred but
	not reported claims and future loss development into specific case reserves for individual claims).
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Changed its individual claim handling practice by recording specific case reserves on new claims at amounts that include all anticipated future costs.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Closed claims more quickly with the goal of reducing the ultimate cost of claims.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Hired an actuarial consultant in May 2014 to study historical claims experience and the actuarial impact of the change in the Company&#146;s claims handling
	process.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Based on analysis associated with the work performed above, management concluded that a significant increase
	in the estimate of workers&#146; compensation liability in 2014 was needed to reflect the potential adverse development of prior period claims. Management&#146;s primary considerations in determining to record a large increase in the Company&#146;s
	estimate of workers&#146; compensation liability in 2014 included the large increase in the Company&#146;s business in recent years, the potential for large future adverse development of open claims, and the increasing complexity and uncertainty
	surrounding healthcare costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	See Note 2. Restatement of Previously Issued Financial Statements for additional information regarding
	restatements related to workers&#146; compensation errors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-31
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage114"></A>

</H5>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">

	Barrett Business Services, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>

	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	6.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Workers&#146; Compensation Claims&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The states of California, Oregon, Maryland, Washington, Delaware and Colorado require us to
	maintain specified investment balances or other financial instruments, to cover potential workers compensation claims losses related to the Company&#146;s current and former status as a self-insured employer. These investment balances were $156.8
	million and $198.5 million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. In partial satisfaction of these requirements at December&nbsp;31, 2015, we have provided surety bonds and standby letters of credit totaling $152.0 million, including the
	California requirement of $147.2 million. The Company satisfied the California requirement through the posting of third party issued surety bonds, backed by a total of $88.3 million in letters of credit. In conjunction with these letters of credit,
	the Company posted $92.4 million in restricted money market funds as collateral.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	7.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Revolving Credit Facility and Long-Term Debt
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company maintains a credit agreement (the &#147;Agreement&#148;) with its principal bank, Wells Fargo Bank, National
	Association (the &#147;Bank&#148;). The Agreement provided for a $40.0 million term loan maturing December&nbsp;31, 2016, as well as a $14.0 million revolving credit line, with a $5.0 million sublimit for unsecured standby letters of credit. The
	outstanding balance on the term loan was $15.0 million at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and $40.0 million at December&nbsp;31, 2014. The Agreement also includes $88.3 million in cash-secured letters of credit to satisfy collateral requirements associated
	with security deposit
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-32
</FONT>
</P>

	Barrett Business Services, Inc.

	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	7.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Revolving Credit Facility and Long-Term Debt&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	requirements for workers&#146; compensation purposes in California. In conjunction with these letters of credit, the Company posted with the Bank as collateral $92.4 million in restricted money
	market funds and restricted certificates of deposit, of which $50.1 million is included in current assets on the consolidated balance sheet at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The term loan with the Bank requires payments of $5.0 million on June&nbsp;30, 2016,&nbsp;September&nbsp;30, 2016 and December&nbsp;31, 2016. The term loan bears interest at the one month LIBOR plus 4.0%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Advances under the revolving credit facility bear interest as selected by the Company of either (a)&nbsp;a daily floating rate of one
	month LIBOR plus 2% or (b)&nbsp;a fixed rate of LIBOR plus 2.0%. The Agreement also provides for an unused commitment fee of 0.35%&nbsp;per year on the average daily unused amount of the revolving credit facility, and a fee of 1.75% of the face
	amount of each letter of credit. The Company had no outstanding borrowings on its revolving credit line at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014. The revolving line of credit expires on October&nbsp;1, 2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The credit facility is collateralized by the Company&#146;s accounts receivable and other rights to receive payment, general intangibles and
	equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Agreement requires the satisfaction of certain financial covenants as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	minimum Fixed Charge Coverage ratio of no less than 1.50:1.0, measured quarterly on a rolling four-quarter basis; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</FONT>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	ratio of restricted and unrestricted cash and marketable securities to workers&#146; compensation and safety incentive liabilities of at least 1.0:1.0, measured
	quarterly.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Agreement includes certain additional covenants as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	capital expenditures may not exceed a total of $5.0 million in 2015 and $4.0 million in 2016 without the Bank&#146;s prior approval;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	incurring additional indebtedness is prohibited without the prior approval of the Bank, other than up to $200,000 per year in purchase money financing and the
	aggregate of all purchase money indebtedness does not exceed $400,000 at any time;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;

<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	quarterly cash dividends up to $0.22 per share may be paid so long as there is no default by the Company and payment would not cause a default.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Agreement also contains customary events of default. If an event of default under the Agreement occurs and is
	continuing, the Bank may declare any outstanding obligations under the Agreement to be immediately due and payable.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>

	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</B>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Revolving Credit Facility and Long-Term Debt&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company is currently in default under the terms of the Agreement based upon the Company&#146;s
	failure to comply with covenants regarding accuracy and timeliness of financial information. We have entered into a forbearance agreement with the Bank in connection with the current default. The forbearance agreement establishes a time period
	during which our lender has voluntarily agreed not to cause the payment obligations under the Agreement to be immediately due and payable, to invoke default interest rates or to exercise any of the Bank&#146;s other rights, powers and remedies. The
	Bank has agreed to forbear from immediate enforcement of its rights and remedies based upon the defaults through June&nbsp;1, 2016. BBSI must deliver its 2015 Form 10-K by June&nbsp;1, 2016 as part of this agreement. In addition, the Bank has agreed
	to forbear from immediate enforcement of its rights and remedies based upon the defaults through June&nbsp;30, 2016 with respect to BBSI&#146;s late filing of its Form 10-Q for the quarter ended March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	At June&nbsp;30 and September&nbsp;30, 2014, the Company was also in violation of the following covenants with its Bank:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	minimum Fixed Charge Coverage ratio of no less than 1.25:1.0, measured quarterly on a rolling four-quarter basis;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	funded Debt: EBITDA of no more than 1.75:1, measured quarterly on a rolling four-quarter basis; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="10%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	ratio of restricted and unrestricted cash and marketable securities to workers&#146; compensation and safety incentive liabilities of at least 1.0:1.0, measured
	quarterly.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	In addition, at December&nbsp;31, 2014 and June&nbsp;30, 2015, the Company was in violation of its ratio
	of restricted and unrestricted cash and marketable securities to workers&#146; compensation and safety liabilities of at least 1.0:1.0. The Company was also in violation of the fixed charge coverage ratio of 1.50:1.0 at December&nbsp;31, 2015. On
	May&nbsp;24, 2016, the Company reached an agreement with the Bank pursuant to which the Bank has agreed to waive these covenant violations upon filing of the 2015 10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	As part of its negotiations with the Bank on the forbearance and waivers discussed above, the Company accelerated to May&nbsp;24, 2016 the payment of $2.5 million of the $5 million originally due December&nbsp;31,
	2016 on its term loan. The Company also agreed to pay the remaining $2.5 million balance on the December&nbsp;31, 2016 payment upon the earlier of December&nbsp;31, 2016 or the receipt of federal unemployment tax refunds. In addition, the Bank
	amended the Agreement to include delisting of the Company&#146;s common stock by NASDAQ as an event of default.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company maintains a
	mortgage loan with the Bank with a balance of approximately $4.8 million and $5.1 million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively, secured by the Company&#146;s corporate office building in Vancouver, Washington. This loan requires
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	payment of monthly principal installments of $18,375, bearing interest at the one month LIBOR plus 2.25%, with the unpaid principal balance due November&nbsp;1, 2017. This mortgage loan is
	included on current portion of long-term debt due to the forbearance agreement with the Bank.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	8.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	401(k) Savings Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We have a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan for the benefit of our eligible employees. All staffing and management employees 21
	years of age or older become eligible to participate in the savings plan upon completion of 1,000 hours of service in any consecutive 12-month period following the initial date of employment. Employees covered under a PEO arrangement may participate
	in the plan at the sole discretion of the PEO client. The determination of discretionary Company contributions to the plan, if any, is at the sole discretion of our Board of Directors. No discretionary Company contributions were made to the plan for
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We make matching contributions to the 401(k) plan under a safe harbor provision,
	whereby the Company matches 100% of contributions by management and staffing employees up to 3% of each participating employee&#146;s annual compensation; and 50% of the employee&#146;s contributions up to an additional 2% of annual compensation. We
	made $1,158,000, $885,000 and $734,000 of matching contributions during 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively. Participants&#146; interests in Company safe harbor contributions to the plan are fully vested when payments are made.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	9.
</B>

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	Commitments
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	We lease office space for our branch offices under operating lease agreements that require minimum annual payments as follows
	(in thousands):

	Rent expense was approximately $4.1 million, $3.7 million and $3.2 million for the years ended December&nbsp;31,

	27.5
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	%&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	(40.1
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	)%&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	26.5
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	%&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PX">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:3PX DOUBLE #000000">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	&nbsp;

</TD>
<TD>
	&nbsp;
</TD>

</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The realization of a significant portion of net deferred tax assets is based in part on our estimates of the timing
	of reversals of certain temporary differences and on the generation of taxable income before such reversals. At December&nbsp;31 2015, we maintained a valuation allowance for approximately $0.2 million of state tax benefits that are not expected to
	be utilized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Under ASC 740, &#147;Income Taxes,&#148; management evaluates the realizability of the deferred tax assets on a quarterly
	basis under a &#147;more-likely than not&#148; standard. As part of this evaluation, management reviews all evidence both positive and negative to determine if a valuation allowance is needed. One component of this analysis is to determine whether
	the Company was in a cumulative loss position for the most recent 12 quarters. The Company was in a cumulative income position for the 12 quarters ended at both December&nbsp;31, 2015 and December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company is subject to Income taxes in U.S. federal and multiple state and local tax jurisdictions. In the major jurisdictions where it
	operates, the Company is generally no longer subject to income tax examinations by tax authorities for years before 2012. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the Company had no unrecognized tax benefits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	A portion of the consolidated income the Company generates is not subject to state income tax. Depending on the percentage of this income as
	compared to total consolidated income, the Company&#146;s state effective rate could fluctuate from expectations. As a result of the mix of income subject to state income tax, total state tax expense increased by approximately $1.7 million in 2015,
	decreased by $720,000 in 2014 and increased by $249,000 in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-37
</FONT>
</P>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	Income Taxes&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s capital loss carry forward expired at December&nbsp;31, 2015. At
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company did not have a federal general business tax credit carry forward. The Company had an alternative minimum tax credit carry forward of approximately $1.8 million which has an indefinite life and will not expire
	until utilized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	At December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company had state tax credit carry forwards of approximately $1.0 million which expire
	unless utilized in tax years on or before December&nbsp;31, 2025.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	11.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Stock Incentive Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company&#146;s 2015 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;2015 Plan&#148;), which provides for stock-based awards to Company
	employees, non-employee directors and outside consultants or advisors, was approved by stockholders on May&nbsp;27, 2015. The number of shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the 2015 Plan is 1,000,000, of which the maximum number of
	shares for which incentive stock options may be granted is 900,000. The 2015 Plan replaced the Company&#146;s 2009 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;2009 Plan&#148;). The Company granted 8,000 and 56,425 restricted stock units during the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 under the 2009 and 2015 Plans, respectively. No new awards may be granted under the 2009 Plan. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were option awards covering 360,100 shares outstanding under the 2009 Plan and its predecessor
	plans. Outstanding options under all the plans generally expire ten years after the date of grant. Options are generally exercisable in four equal annual installments beginning one year after the date of grant. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, there were
	also 150,811 restricted stock units outstanding, which are settled in an equal number of shares of common stock upon vesting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The
	Company recognizes compensation expense for stock-based awards under its stock incentive plans based on the grant-date fair value. Compensation expense is attributed to earnings using the straight-line method over the requisite service period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	F-38

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The aggregate intrinsic value of stock options represents the difference between the Company&#146;s closing stock
	price at the end of the period and the relevant exercise price multiplied by the number of options outstanding at the end of the period at each such price.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	There were no options granted below market price during 2015. There were no options granted during 2014 or 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	During 2015, 2014 and 2013, the Company granted 64,425, 69,371 and 44,970 restricted stock units at a weighted average grant date fair
	value of $37.79, $50.47 and $50.28 per share, respectively. The restricted stock units vest in four equal annual installments beginning one year following the date of grant.
</FONT>
</P>

	2015
</B>
</FONT>

	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	12.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Stock Repurchase Program
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company maintains a stock repurchase program approved by the Board of Directors, which authorizes the repurchase of shares
	from time to time in open market purchases. The repurchase program currently allows for the repurchase of approximately 1.1&nbsp;million additional shares as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	No share repurchases were made under the repurchase program during 2015 and 2013. The Company repurchased 87,200 shares at a weighted average price
	of $42.16 during 2014. The Company&#146;s credit agreement with its Bank prohibits the Company from repurchasing its shares without the Bank&#146;s prior written consent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-41
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage124"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
<B>
	Barrett Business Services, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
</B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Litigation
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On November&nbsp;6, 2014, plaintiffs in
<I>
	Michael Arciaga, et al. v. Barrett Business Services, Inc., et al.
</I>
	, filed an
	action in the United States District Court for the Western District of Washington against BBSI, Michael L. Elich, BBSI&#146;s Chief Executive Officer, and James D. Miller, BBSI&#146;s then Chief Financial Officer. The action purported to be a class
	action brought on behalf of all Company shareholders alleging violations of the federal securities laws. The claims arose from the decline in the market price for BBSI common stock following announcement of a charge for increased workers
	compensation reserves expense. The lawsuit sought compensatory damages (in an amount to be determined at trial), plus interest, and costs and expenses (including attorney fees and expert fees).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On November&nbsp;13, 2014, a second purported shareholder class action was filed in the United States District Court for the Western District of
	Washington, entitled
<I>
	Christopher&nbsp;P. Carnes, et al. v. Barrett Business Services, Inc., et al
</I>
	. The
<I>
	Carnes
</I>
	complaint named the same defendants as the
<I>
	Arciaga
</I>
	case and asserted similar claims for relief.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Similarly, on November&nbsp;17, 2014, a third purported shareholder class action was filed in the United States District Court for the Western
	District of Washington, entitled
<I>
	Shiva Stein, et al. v. Barrett Business Services, Inc., et al.
</I>
	The
<I>
	Stein
</I>
	complaint named the same defendants as the
<I>
	Arciaga
</I>
	and
<I>
	Carnes
</I>
	cases and asserted similar claims for relief.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On February&nbsp;25, 2015, the court ordered consolidation of the three cases, and any new or other cases involving the same subject
	matter, into a single action for pretrial purposes. The consolidated cases were recaptioned as
<I>
	In re Barrett Business Services Securities Litigation.
</I>
	The court also appointed the Painters&nbsp;&amp; Allied Trades District Council No.&nbsp;35
	Pension and Annuity Funds as the lead plaintiff. Discovery has not been undertaken as it is automatically stayed under the federal Private Securities Litigation Reform Act.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On April&nbsp;29, 2015, the plaintiffs in the class action filed a consolidated amended complaint, naming BBSI, Elich and Miller as defendants. On June&nbsp;12, 2015, defendants filed a motion to dismiss the
	consolidated amended complaint.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On November&nbsp;23, 2015, before the court had ruled on the motion to dismiss, plaintiffs filed a
	first amended consolidated complaint, naming the same defendants. The first amended consolidated complaint included new allegations relating to disclosures in BBSI&#146;s Current Report on Form 8-K filed on November&nbsp;9, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On February&nbsp;16, 2016, BBSI filed a motion to dismiss the first amended consolidated complaint. That same day, Messrs. Elich and Miller,
	through separate counsel, also filed motions to dismiss the first amended consolidated complaint, adopting BBSI&#146;s motion in its entirety.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-42
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage125"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D62398D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="4">
<B>
	Barrett Business Services, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
</B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	13.
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="3">
<B>
	Litigation&nbsp;(Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On March&nbsp;21, 2016, before the court had ruled on the motion to dismiss the first amended
	consolidated complaint, plaintiffs filed a second amended consolidated complaint, naming the same defendants. The second amended consolidated complaint dropped certain allegations from the first amended complaint and added new allegations relating
	to disclosures in BBSI&#146;s Current Report on Form 8-K filed on March&nbsp;9, 2016. Among other disclosures, BBSI reported that (1)&nbsp;previously issued financial statements could not be relied on, (2)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Miller had reported making
	unsupported journal entries, (3)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Miller&#146;s employment had been terminated, and (4)&nbsp;BBSI was in the process of engaging a Big Four accounting firm to conduct an independent forensic accounting investigation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	BBSI responded to the second amended consolidated complaint by filing a motion to dismiss on May&nbsp;23, 2016. Messrs. Elich and Miller joined in
	that motion. Under the current briefing schedule ordered by the court, plaintiffs&#146; opposition to the motion to dismiss is due June&nbsp;27, 2016, and any reply is due July&nbsp;25, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	BBSI received a subpoena from the San Francisco office of the Division of Enforcement of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the
	&#147;SEC&#148;) in May 2015 in connection with the SEC&#146;s investigation of the Company&#146;s accounting practices with regard to its workers&#146; compensation reserves. In April 2016, the SEC issued a second subpoena to BBSI for documents
	relating to the disclosures made by the Company following Mr.&nbsp;Miller&#146;s termination. BBSI is cooperating fully with the SEC staff in its investigation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	On June&nbsp;17, 2015, Daniel Salinas (&#147;Salinas&#148;) filed a shareholder derivative lawsuit against BBSI and certain of its officers and directors in the Circuit Court for Baltimore City, Maryland. The
	complaint alleges breaches of fiduciary duty, unjust enrichment and other violations of law and seeks recovery of various damages, including the costs and expenses incurred in connection with the Company&#146;s reserve strengthening process, reserve
	study and consultants, the cost of stock repurchases by BBSI in October 2014, compensation paid to the Company&#146;s officers, and costs of negotiating the Company&#146;s credit facility with its principal lender, as well as the proceeds of sales
	of stock by certain of BBSI&#146;s officers and directors during 2013 and 2014. On September&nbsp;28, 2015, the Company and the individual defendants filed motions to dismiss the derivative suit and a motion to stay pending resolution of
<I>
	In re
	Barrett Business Services Securities Litigation
</I>
	. On December&nbsp;4, 2015, Salinas filed an opposition to each motion. On January&nbsp;27, 2016, the defendants filed a reply to the opposition brief. On February&nbsp;11, 2016, Judge Michel
	Pierson heard oral argument on the motions. A decision has not yet been issued.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Management is unable to estimate the probability, or
	the potential range, of loss arising from the legal actions described above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	BBSI is subject to other legal proceedings and claims,
	which arise in the ordinary course of our business. In the opinion of management, the amount of ultimate liability with respect to other currently pending or threatened actions is not expected to materially affect the Company&#146;s consolidated
	financial position or results of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	F-43
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	Subsequent to December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company reached an agreement to pay its third party provider of MCC services $10.0
	million in exchange for the elimination of all future

	F-61

<A NAME="eolPage144"></A>

	Barrett Business Services, Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements&nbsp;(Continued)

	15.

<B>
	Subsequent Events&nbsp;(Continued)

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	MCC fees on workers&#146; compensation claims incurred on or before December&nbsp;31, 2015. Under this agreement the Company will make quarterly payments of $1,250,000 starting April&nbsp;1, 2016
	and continuing through January&nbsp;1, 2018. The agreement includes certain limitations on total claims and services. The Company and its third party provider also agreed to a per claim fixed fee structure on all claims incurred after
	December&nbsp;31, 2015. BBSI was current on its quarterly payments as of April&nbsp;1, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:ARIAL" SIZE="2">
	The Company accelerated to May&nbsp;24,
	2016 the payment of $2.5 million of the $5 million payment originally due December&nbsp;31, 2016 on its term loan.
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	Exhibit 10.11

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

	AWARD AGREEMENT

	Barrett Business Services, Inc.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	2009 Stock Incentive Plan
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="72%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;,

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Corporation maintains the Barrett Business Services, Inc., 2009 Stock Incentive Plan (the &#147;Plan&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Award Agreement evidences the grant of an Incentive Stock Option (the &#147;Option&#148;) to Participant.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The parties agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	1. Defined
	Terms
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	When used in this Agreement, the following terms have the meaning specified below:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(a) &#147;
<U>
	Acquiring Person
</U>
	&#148;
</B>
	means any person or related person or related persons which constitute a
	&#147;group&#148; for purposes of Section&nbsp;13(d) and Rule 13d-5 under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &#147;Exchange Act&#148;), as such Section and Rule are in effect as of the Grant Date; provided, however, that the term Acquiring
	Person shall not include (i)&nbsp;Corporation or any of its Subsidiaries, (ii)&nbsp;any employee benefit plan of Corporation or any of its Subsidiaries, (iii)&nbsp;any entity holding voting capital stock of Corporation for or pursuant to the terms
	of any such employee benefit plan, or (iv)&nbsp;any person or group solely because such person or group has voting power with respect to capital stock of Corporation arising from a revocable proxy or consent given in response to a public proxy or
	consent solicitation made pursuant to the Exchange Act.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(b) &#147;
<U>
	Change in Control
</U>
	&#148;
</B>
	means:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(i) A change in control of Corporation of a nature that would be required to be reported in response to Item&nbsp;6(e) of
	Schedule 14A of Regulation 14A
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-&nbsp;1&nbsp;-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage151"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	as in effect on the Grant Date pursuant to the Exchange Act; provided that, without limitation, such a change in control shall be deemed to have occurred at such time as any Acquiring Person
	hereafter becomes the &#147;beneficial owner&#148; (as defined in Rule 13d-3 under the Exchange Act), directly or indirectly, of 30&nbsp;percent or more of the combined voting power of Voting Securities; or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(ii) During any period of 12 consecutive calendar months, individuals who at the beginning of such period constitute the Board
	cease for any reason to constitute at least a majority thereof unless the election, or the nomination for election, by Corporation shareholders of each new director was approved by a vote of at least a majority of the directors then in office who
	were directors at the beginning of the period; or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(ii) There shall be consummated (i)&nbsp;any consolidation or merger of
	Corporation in which Corporation is not the continuing or surviving corporation or pursuant to which Voting Securities would be converted into cash, securities, or other property, other than a merger of Corporation in which the holders of Voting
	Securities immediately prior to the merger have the same proportionate ownership of common stock of the surviving corporation immediately after the merger, or (ii)&nbsp;any sale, lease, exchange, or other transfer (in one transaction or a series of
	related transactions) of all, or substantially all, of the assets of Corporation; or
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(iv) Approval by the shareholders of
	Corporation of any plan or proposal for the liquidation or dissolution of Corporation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(c) &#147;
<U>
	Change in Control
	Date
</U>
	&#148;
</B>
	means the first date following the Grant Date on which a Change in Control has occurred.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(d)
	&#147;
<U>
	Employer
</U>
	&#148;
</B>
	means Corporation or a Subsidiary of Corporation.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(e) &#147;
<U>
	Grant Date
</U>
	&#148;
</B>
	means the date the Option is granted, which is reflected as the date of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	(f) &#147;
<U>
	Voting
	Securities
</U>
	&#148;
</B>
	means Corporation&#146;s issued and outstanding securities ordinarily having the right to vote at elections for director.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Capitalized terms not otherwise defined in this Agreement have the meanings given them in the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	2. Grant of Option
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subject to the terms
	and conditions of this Agreement and the Plan, Corporation grants to Participant the Option to purchase
<U>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
	&nbsp;Shares of Corporation&#146;s common
	stock at $
<U>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
	per share.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-&nbsp;2&nbsp;-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage152"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	3. Terms of Option
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Option is subject to all the provisions of the Plan and to the following terms and conditions:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	3.1 Term
</U>
	. The term of the Option is ten years from the Grant Date and will automatically terminate on
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;, 20__, to the extent not exercised, unless terminated earlier in accordance with this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	3.2 Time of Exercise
</U>
	. Unless the Option is otherwise terminated or the time of its exercisability is accelerated in accordance with
	this Agreement, the Option may be exercised from time to time to purchase Shares up to the following limits (based on years after the Grant Date and including any Shares previously purchased pursuant to the Option):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a) During the first year
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-
</FONT>
	none;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b) During the second year
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-
</FONT>
	up to 25 percent of the total Shares;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c) During the third year
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-
</FONT>
	up to 50 percent of the total Shares;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(d) During the fourth year
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-
</FONT>
	up to 75 percent of the total Shares; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(e) After the fourth year
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	-
</FONT>
	100 percent.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	3.3 Employment Requirement
</U>
	. Except as otherwise provided in subsection&nbsp;3.4 of this Agreement, the Option may not be exercised
	unless Participant is employed by an Employer continuously for at least one year following the Grant Date, unless employment is terminated by death, Disability, or Retirement. For purposes of this Agreement, &#147;employment&#148; includes periods
	of illness or other leaves of absence authorized by the Employer. If Participant ceases to be an active employee, the Option will remain exercisable, to the extent the Option had become exercisable on or before the termination date, and the right to
	exercise the Option will expire at the end of the following periods:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
